005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import java.util.Collection;
009import java.util.function.Predicate;
010
011import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
012
013import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
015
016public interface IModelDefinition extends IDefinition, IContainer {
017  /**
018   * Tests if the provided definition represents complex data. The data is complex
019   * if one of the following is true:
020   * <ul>
021   * <li>The instance is a {@link IAssemblyDefinition}.</li>
022   * <li>The instance is a {@link IFieldDefinition} that has flags.</li>
023   * </ul>
024   *
025   * This method can be used as a {@link Predicate}.
026   *
027   * @param definition
028   *          the definition to test
029   * @return {@code true} if the data is complex, or {@code false} otherwise
030   */
031  static boolean complexObjectFilter(IModelDefinition definition) {
032    boolean retval = true;
033    if (definition instanceof IFieldDefinition) {
034      IFieldDefinition field = (IFieldDefinition) definition;
035      retval = !field.getFlagInstances().isEmpty();
036    }
037    return retval;
038  }
039
040  @Override
041  default boolean hasChildren() {
042    return !getFlagInstances().isEmpty();
043  }
044
045  /**
046   * Retrieves a flag instance, by the flag's effective name, that is defined on
047   * the containing definition.
048   *
049   * @param name
050   *          the flag's name
051   * @return the matching flag instance, or {@code null} if there is no flag
052   *         matching the specified name
053   */
054  @Nullable
055  IFlagInstance getFlagInstanceByName(@NonNull QName name);
056
057  /**
058   * Retrieves the flag instances for all flags defined on the containing
059   * definition.
060   *
061   * @return the flags
062   */
063  @NonNull
064  Collection<? extends IFlagInstance> getFlagInstances();
065
066  /**
067   * Retrieves the flag instance to use as as the property name for the containing
068   * object in JSON who's value will be the object containing the flag.
069   *
070   * @return the flag instance if a JSON key is configured, or {@code null}
071   *         otherwise
072   */
073  // TODO: remove once moved to the instance side
074  @Nullable
075  IFlagInstance getJsonKey();
076}
